Chinese_text: 2021年的冬天,我回了一趟老家探望外婆。那年她身体不好,住在离村子不远的小镇医院里。冬天的风特别刺骨,我拎着一袋她喜欢吃的水果走进了医院。外婆见到我时,脸上露出了久违的笑容。她说,你怎么知道我最想吃的就是橙子?我们在病房里聊了很多,我问她治疗的怎么样,她却总是岔开话题,说家里最近的事情,比如新盖的房子,种下的几棵果树。我能看出她在努力表现得很坚强,但也能感受到她眼中藏不住的疲惫。下午的时候,我推着她的轮椅到医院后面的花园。冬天的阳光很淡,却让人觉得温暖。外婆静静地看着那些枯黄的树叶,忽然开口问我,你是不是觉得时间过得太快了?我没回答,因为我也有同样的感受。她开始讲起年轻时候的故事,说她当年如何背着我母亲翻过一座山去找工作,又如何在最艰难的时候种田养家,我听着这些故事,心里忽然觉得很愧疚。愧疚于自己平时总觉得工作忙,没时间回来看她,而她却从未抱怨我不常回家。离开医院的时候,我回头看了看花园里的她,阳光落在她的白发上,我心里想着,以后无论多忙,我都要经常回来看她,因为陪伴才是最好的。这是她最需要的东西。
English_text: In the winter of 2021, I went back to my hometown to visit my grandmother. That year she was not in good health and lived in a small town hospital not far from the village. The winter wind is particularly piercing, and I walked into the hospital carrying a bag of fruits that she likes to eat. When my grandmother saw me, a long lost smile appeared on her face. She said, 'How do you know that the one I want to eat the most is oranges?'? We talked a lot in the ward, and when I asked her how her treatment was, she always changed the subject and talked about recent things at home, such as the newly built house and the few fruit trees planted. I can see that she is trying hard to appear strong, but I can also feel the exhaustion that cannot be hidden in her eyes. In the afternoon, I pushed her wheelchair to the garden behind the hospital. The winter sunshine is very light, but it makes people feel warm. Grandma quietly looked at the withered yellow leaves and suddenly asked me, do you think time passes too quickly? I didn't answer because I feel the same way too. She began to tell stories from her youth, about how she carried my mother over a mountain to find a job, and how she had to farm and support her family during the toughest times. Listening to these stories, I suddenly felt guilty. I feel guilty that I always feel busy with work and don't have time to come back to see her, but she never complains that I don't come home often. When I left the hospital, I turned back to look at her in the garden. The sunshine fell on her white hair, and I thought to myself, no matter how busy I am in the future, I will come back to see her often because companionship is the best. This is what she needs the most.

Chinese_text: 2022年暑假,我终于实现了去云南旅行的梦想。云南的美景和独特文化一直是我向往的,而这次旅行让我深深感受到它的魅力。最让我难忘的是在尔海边骑行的一天,那种自由和宁静的感觉至今难忘。清晨,我从大理古城租了一辆自行车,沿着尔海的湖边小道骑行。尔海的水面在清晨时分如镜子般平静,倒映着周围的青山和天上的白云。清风轻轻吹过,湖面泛起点点涟漪。阳光洒在水面上,整个画面仿佛是从画中走出来的。我边骑车边拍照,不时停下来欣赏眼前的美景。一路上,我遇到了许多同样骑行的游客,有的来自南方,有的来自国外。大家都被尔海的宁静之美所折服。中午,我在湖边的一家小餐厅停下,品尝了地道的云南美食,特别是当地的烤乳扇。外焦里嫩,奶香浓郁,让人异口难忘。下午,我继续骑行,一路欣赏尔海的不同角度。有些地方可以看到渔船在湖面上缓缓划过,有些地方则被稻田和小村庄环绕,每一处风景都令人流连忘返。半晚时分,我在尔海边的观景台坐下,夕阳染红了整个湖面,渔船归航的景象安静而美丽,我感受到一种前所未有的宁静与满足。这次旅行,不只在湖面上,也在海边上。这次旅行,不只在湖面上,也在海边上。不仅让我看到了尔海的美,也让我更懂得如何在生活中找到内心的宁静。
English_text: In the summer of 2022, I finally realized my dream of traveling to Yunnan. The beautiful scenery and unique culture of Yunnan have always been my dream, and this trip has deeply impressed me with its charm. The most unforgettable day for me was riding by the seaside, the feeling of freedom and tranquility that remains unforgettable to this day. In the morning, I rented a bike from Dali Old City and rode along the lake path of Erhai. The water surface of Erhai is as calm as a mirror in the early morning, reflecting the surrounding green mountains and white clouds in the sky. The gentle breeze blows, causing ripples to appear on the surface of the lake. The sunlight shines on the water, and the whole picture seems to come out of the painting. I take photos while riding my bike, occasionally stopping to appreciate the beautiful scenery in front of me. Along the way, I met many tourists who rode the same bike, some from the south and some from abroad. Everyone was impressed by the peaceful beauty of Erhai. At noon, I stopped at a small restaurant by the lake and tasted authentic Yunnan cuisine, especially the local roasted milk fan. It is crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, with a rich milk aroma that leaves an unforgettable impression. In the afternoon, I continued cycling and enjoyed different angles of Erhai along the way. In some places, fishing boats can be seen slowly gliding over the lake, while in others, rice paddies and small villages surround each other, making every scenery unforgettable. Halfway through the night, I sat down at the observation deck by the seaside. The sunset dyed the entire lake red, and the scene of fishing boats returning home was quiet and beautiful. I felt an unprecedented sense of tranquility and satisfaction. This trip is not only on the lake, but also by the seaside. This trip is not only on the lake, but also by the seaside. Not only did it show me the beauty of Erhai, but it also taught me how to find inner peace in life.

Chinese_text: 这是我的故事。我的旅程从著名的故宫开始,它是世界上最大保存最完整的皇宫建筑群。当我踏入那巨大的红色宫门时,仿佛穿越到了历史中。精美的雕刻,金碧辉煌的屋顶和广阔的庭院展现了明清皇朝的辉煌气势。在游览太和殿和御花园时,我对这里的建筑工艺丰富的历史着着着迷。接着,我前往距离市区不远的长城沐浴田段,这段长城以壮丽的景色和较少的游客而闻名。攀登过程虽然辛苦,但站在顶端遥望绵延的山岭和延伸的长城,所有的疲惫都烟消云散。站在这座古老的防御工程上,我感受到了一种穿越千年的震撼。回到市中心,我参观了天安门广场,这是世界上最大的广场之一。广场的规模,壮观规模令人震撼,我花了一些时间沉思它的文化和历史意义。不远处,我还参观了天坛,一座明代的建筑杰作。那原型的祈年殿,即壮观的建筑。这座明代的建筑,又象征了天人合一的理念。北京的美食同样的严深,我品尝了著名的北京烤鸭。这道传承百年的美味令我回味无穷。厨师娴熟的切片,薄脆的鸭皮和柔嫩的鸭肉,搭配薄饼和甜面酱,简直是味觉的盛宴。晚上,我漫步在热闹的胡同里,这些狭窄的巷子展现了北京传统的一面。小院子街边的小吃摊和特色小吃摊,让我感觉到当地人的生活真实与悠闲。北京是一种充满对比的城市,古老的传统和现代的创新在这里交织。每一刻都像一段精彩的故事,我很幸运能成为它的一部分。
English_text: This is my story. My journey begins with the famous Forbidden City, which is the largest and most well preserved imperial palace complex in the world. When I stepped into the huge red palace gate, it felt like I had traveled back in time. Exquisite carvings, magnificent roofs, and vast courtyards showcase the glorious momentum of the Ming and Qing dynasties. When visiting the Hall of Supreme Harmony and the Imperial Garden, I was fascinated by the rich history of architectural craftsmanship here. Next, I headed to the Bathing Field section of the Great Wall, which is not far from the city center and is known for its magnificent scenery and relatively few tourists. Although the climbing process was arduous, standing at the top and gazing at the stretching mountains and the extended Great Wall, all exhaustion dissipated into thin air. Standing on this ancient defense project, I felt a shock that lasted for thousands of years. Returning to the city center, I visited Tiananmen Square, which is one of the largest squares in the world. The scale of the square is breathtaking, and I spent some time contemplating its cultural and historical significance. Not far away, I also visited the Temple of Heaven, a masterpiece of Ming Dynasty architecture. The prototype of the Hall of Prayer for Good Harvests is a magnificent building. This Ming Dynasty building also symbolizes the concept of harmony between heaven and man. The cuisine in Beijing is equally authentic, and I tasted the famous Beijing roast duck. This delicious dish that has been passed down for a hundred years leaves an endless aftertaste for me. The chef's skillful slicing, crispy duck skin, and tender duck meat, paired with thin pancakes and sweet sauce, is simply a feast for the taste buds. At night, I stroll through the bustling alleys, which showcase the traditional side of Beijing. The street side snack stalls and specialty snack stalls in Xiaoyuanzi make me feel the authentic and leisurely life of the locals. Beijing is a city full of contrasts, where ancient traditions and modern innovation are intertwined. Every moment is like a wonderful story, and I am fortunate to be a part of it.

Chinese_text: 在2020年,我报名参加了学校组织的美国严选活动。我跟我的另外两个同学以及许多老师同学们一起参加了这次美国旅行。在1月15号我们抵达的美国纽约之后的旅行都是乘坐大巴进行的。我跟我同学一起吃了一顿非常丰盛的早餐。那是一家中式餐厅,早餐有我熟悉的包子,饺子,粥,还有馒头之类的。之后,我们一起乘坐大巴,沿着大巴看街上的美国风景。我在车上看到了美国本土的星巴克以及一个哥特什的建筑,我还拍照纪念下来。之后,我跟我同学一起来到哥伦比亚大学进行参观游览。大学的广场非常广泛。阳光洒在草坪上,非常赏心悦目。当时是冬天,所以我们穿着羽绒服漫步在哥伦比亚大学里。我看到了不同学院的各具特色的建筑,包括哲学院的和法学院的。我还看到有鸽子在地面上散步,非常和谐美好的一幕。哥伦比亚大学智慧女神雅典娜雕像非常的端庄素美。在这次的参观,我感到很高兴。但是,大学的参观结束之后,我跟我同学还有老师们一起在这个雕像面前合影留念。之后,我们坐大巴去到了华尔街。我摸到了著名的金牛雕像。听说摸了它的牛角,它能为我带来财富,也算是一个美好的寓意了。我也在这个金牛雕像面前合影留念了。之后,我跟我的团队一起乘坐游轮去观摩自由女神像。若不是亲眼所见,我是一定不会感受到它的壮观和美丽的。果然,图片带给人的感觉跟亲眼看的完全不一样。现场看到的自由女神像,那叫一个蔚为壮观的。在阳光下,它高举着火炬,像是在抗争为了自由。我总共在美国待了七天就回国了。我感觉这次的旅行非常精彩,并且很有意义。
English_text: In 2020, I registered to participate in the school's organized American selection event. I participated in this trip to the United States with my other two classmates and many teachers and classmates. After arriving in New York, USA on January 15th, all our travels were taken by bus. I had a very sumptuous breakfast with my classmates. It's a Chinese restaurant. I am familiar with steamed buns, dumplings, Congee, and Mantou for breakfast. Afterwards, we took a bus together and watched the American scenery on the street along the bus. I saw a Starbucks in the United States and a Gothic building in the car, and I even took photos to commemorate it. Afterwards, my classmates and I visited Columbia University for sightseeing. The university square is very extensive. The sunlight shining on the lawn is very pleasing to the eye. It was winter at the time, so we strolled around Columbia University wearing down jackets. I have seen the distinctive buildings of different colleges, including the School of Philosophy and the School of Law. I also saw pigeons walking on the ground, a very harmonious and beautiful scene. The statue of Athena, the goddess of wisdom at Columbia University, is very dignified and beautiful. I feel very happy during this visit. However, after the university visit, my classmates, teachers, and I took a group photo in front of this statue as a memento. Afterwards, we took a bus to Wall Street. I touched the famous golden bull statue. I heard that touching its horn can bring me wealth, which is also a beautiful symbolism. I also took a photo in front of this golden bull statue as a souvenir. Afterwards, my team and I took a cruise to observe the Statue of Liberty. If I hadn't seen it with my own eyes, I wouldn't have felt its magnificence and beauty. Sure enough, the feeling that pictures give people is completely different from what they see with their own eyes. The Statue of Liberty seen on site is truly magnificent. In the sunlight, it held up a torch as if fighting for freedom. I stayed in the United States for a total of seven days before returning home. I feel that this trip was very exciting and meaningful.

Chinese_text: 今天我想和大家分享我去年的陕西之旅,当我踏上这片古老的土地,心中充满了期待与敬畏。我在陕西之旅的第一站是西安,这座千年古都仿佛述说着历史的沧桑。漫步在古城墙上,我仿佛能听到历史的回音,每一块砖石都承载着厚重的历史。我走进兵马俑博物馆,那一列列栩栩如生的陶俑,让我感受到了秦始皇统一六国的霸气与辉煌。接着,我来到了新华宫,这里曾是唐玄宗与杨贵妃的爱情见证地。漫步在温泉旁,我仿佛看到他们当年在此嬉戏的场景,感受到那份跨越千年的浪漫。当然,陕西美食也是不容错过的。这一碗热腾腾的羊肉泡馍,让我品尝到了当地地道的风味,那浓郁的汤汁,鲜嫩的羊肉,还有那香脆的模块,每一口都让我回味无休。这次的陕西之旅,让我深刻感受到了中华文明的博大精深,从古老的城墙到壮观的兵马俑,从浪漫的清华宫到美味的羊肉泡馍。每……陕西的每一个地方都让我流连忘返。在这……陕西,在这片深溪的土地,不仅让我领略了历史的厚重,更让我感受到了中华文化的魅力。我相信,每一个来到陕西的人,都会被这里的魅力所折服。每一个来到陕西的人,在他有生之年内都会再次希望来到陕西,这座历史…………悠久的城市。人代 erg形容是笔触,在 Dharma appearance 中称为—— reciprocity.
English_text: Today, I would like to share with you my trip to Shaanxi last year. As I stepped onto this ancient land, my heart was filled with anticipation and awe. My first stop on my trip to Shaanxi was Xi'an, a thousand year old ancient capital that seems to narrate the vicissitudes of history. Strolling along the ancient city walls, I feel like I can hear the echoes of history, as every brick and stone carries a heavy weight of history. When I walked into the Terra Cotta Warriors Museum, I felt the hegemony and glory of Qin Shihuang's unification of the six countries through the lifelike terracotta warriors. Then, I arrived at Xinhua Palace, which was once a witness to the love between Emperor Xuanzong of Tang and Yang Guifei. Strolling by the hot springs, I seem to see the scene of them playing here back then, and feel the romance that spans thousands of years. Of course, Shaanxi cuisine is also not to be missed. This bowl of hot Pita bread soaked in Lamb Soup gave me a taste of the local flavor. The rich soup, fresh mutton, and crispy modules left me with endless aftertaste. This trip to Shaanxi made me deeply feel the breadth and depth of Chinese civilization, from the ancient city walls to the spectacular Terra Cotta Warriors, from the romantic Qinghua Palace to the delicious Pita bread soaked in Lamb Soup. Every place in Shaanxi makes me linger and forget to leave. In Shaanxi, in this land of deep streams, not only did I appreciate the weight of history, but I also felt the charm of Chinese culture. I believe that everyone who comes to Shaanxi will be impressed by the charm here. Every person who comes to Shaanxi will hope to come to Shaanxi again in their lifetime, this city with a long history. The term "ergo" is used to describe the brushstrokes, which are referred to as "reciprocity" in Dharma appearance

Chinese_text: 我曾经在一年之内数次去过南京,真的是一个很美丽的城市。我最好的哥们在那边上学,我们一起在校门外,小吃街大快朵頤,漫步于银河路之间,骑过梧桐掩映的城墙下。无论是景色,气候还是文化,南京都如此让我满足。对于一个北方长大的人来说,南京就是想象中南方城市最美好的样子。在最美的季节流连于頤和路。晴天阳光透过树叶的飞翼。风稀。斑驳的光影洒在石砖上。这些建筑来自民国时期。一如路边忘不到尽头的梧桐树。确实对得起一条頤和路绊扑民国时的美意。南京是一座贯通古今的城市。深厚的文化底蕴被完好的保留了下来。在其侧,一座座万丈高楼拔地而起。构建起优美的现在的都市天际线。
English_text: I have visited Nanjing several times within a year, it is truly a beautiful city. My best friend goes to school over there. We go to school together outside the school gate, eat in the snack street, walk between the Milky Way Road, and ride under the city wall set off by wutong. Whether it's the scenery, climate, or culture, Nanjing satisfies me so much. For someone who grew up in the north, Nanjing is the most beautiful image of a southern city in their imagination. Wander on Yihe Road during the most beautiful season. On a sunny day, the sun shines through the wings of the leaves. The wind is weak. The mottled light and shadow spilled on the stone bricks. These buildings come from the Republican era. Like the wutong tree that can't forget the end of the road. It truly lives up to the good intentions of the Republic of China when it stumbled upon the Yihe Road. Nanjing is a city that connects ancient and modern times. The profound cultural heritage has been well preserved. On its side, towering skyscrapers rise from the ground. Build a beautiful urban skyline today.
Extracted_Text: 我曾经在一年之内数次去过南京,真的是一个很美丽的城市。我最好的哥们在那边上学,我们一起在校门外,小吃街大快朵頤,漫步于银河路之间,骑过梧桐掩映的城墙下。无论是景色,气候还是文化,南京都如此让我满足。对于一个北方长大的人来说,南京就是想象中南方城市最美好的样子。在最美的季节流连于頤和路。晴天阳光透过树叶的飞翼。风稀。斑驳的光影洒在石砖上。这些建筑来自民国时期。一如路边忘不到尽头的梧桐树。确实对得起一条頤和路绊扑民国时的美意。南京是一座贯通古今的城市。深厚的文化底蕴被完好的保留了下来。在其侧,一座座万丈高楼拔地而起。构建起优美的现在的都市天际线。

Chinese_text: 去年秋天,在国庆假期期间,我去了杭州,来访了一个多年未见的朋友。这次旅程对我来说非常特别,因为杭州是我一直想去还没有去的地方。而这位朋友是我的高中同学,我们自从上大学后就各自忙碌,再也没有见面。那天,我一早坐上去杭州的高铁,车窗外的景色,从繁华的城市如也变成青山绿水,一路上我充满期待。到达杭州后,朋友在车站接我,我们见面的那一刻,彼此都笑了,仿佛回到了高中时光。他带我去了他推荐的那条老街,那是一条非常安静的步行街,两旁是老旧的房屋和小商铺,他说这里保留了他在大学时期两年的记忆,是他最喜欢的地方之一。我们在街边小银座下,和立凡之后获得规划无粉,那种淡淡的甜美和规划的香气,让我感受到一种家的温暖。我慢慢走在老街上,看着那些卖手工艺品的小摊,朋友给我讲述了他在这里两年大学时期发生的故事。他说每当难过时,或有什么开心的事情,都会来这条步行街三星游玩。我看着他的笑容,仿佛也看到了他,当时在这条街的样子。下午的时候,我们去了西湖,湖边的柳树已经略微泛黄,湖水在阳光下闪烁着金色的光芒。我们租了一只小船,慢悠悠的划到湖心,湖面上风很轻,带着淡淡的凉意。朋友和我聊了很多,关于他大学生活,他的兴趣爱好,还有他对未来的打算。我们也聊起了高中时的点点滴滴,那些有密集,宝月被咬一处的游玩的日子,时间过得很快,夕阳渐渐西沉,湖面上微染上一片橙红色。那天晚上,我们在湖边的小饭馆吃了一顿晚餐,虽然只是一顿家常菜,但因为有老朋友的陪伴,显得额外美味。饭后,我们散步在湖边,看着远处的灯火,倒影在湖边上,像是无数的星星洒落在水中,我深吸一口气,感觉这一刻的宁静和美好,将永远留在我记忆中。
English_text: Last autumn, during the National Day holiday, I went to Hangzhou and visited a friend whom I hadn't seen in many years. This journey is very special to me because Hangzhou is a place I have always wanted to go to but haven't. And this friend is my high school classmate. Since we started college, we have been busy on our own and haven't seen each other again. That day, I boarded the high-speed train in Hangzhou early in the morning, and the scenery outside the window transformed from a bustling city to lush mountains and clear waters. Along the way, I was full of anticipation. After arriving in Hangzhou, my friend picked me up at the station. At the moment we met, we both smiled, as if we were back in high school. He took me to the old street he recommended, which is a very quiet pedestrian street lined with old houses and small shops. He said it preserves his memories of two years in college and is one of his favorite places. We met at the small Ginza on the street, and after getting together with Lifan, we obtained a plan without fans. The faint sweetness and fragrance of planning made me feel a warmth of home. I slowly walked on the old street, watching the small stalls selling handicrafts. My friend told me the story of his two years of college here. He said that whenever he felt sad or had something happy, he would come to this pedestrian street to visit Samsung. I looked at his smile as if I also saw him, what he looked like on this street at that time. In the afternoon, we went to West Lake. The willow trees by the lake had already turned slightly yellow, and the lake was shining with a golden light in the sunlight. We rented a small boat and paddled slowly to the center of the lake. The wind on the surface of the lake was very light, with a faint coolness. My friend and I talked a lot about his college life, his hobbies, and his plans for the future. We also talked about the bits and pieces of our high school days, those days of intensive play where Baoyue was bitten. Time passed quickly, as the sunset gradually set and the lake surface was slightly tinged with orange red. That night, we had dinner at a small restaurant by the lake. Although it was just a home cooked meal, it was extra delicious with the company of old friends. After dinner, we took a walk by the lake, watching the distant lights reflecting on the lake, like countless stars falling in the water. I took a deep breath and felt the tranquility and beauty of this moment, which will forever remain in my memory.

Chinese_text: 在一个阳光明媚的周末,我决定去探望我小时候的好朋友小宇。我们已经有好几年没有见面了,心中充满了期待和紧张,还有就是可能也是对他的一种想念吧。当我走进他家时,几乎感受到当年一块玩的气息。我们这的人管这样从小玩到大的朋友叫发小。这种感觉十分奇妙,就是当年从小互相看着对方一起长大的。墙上的照片依旧定格着我们那个时候无数快乐的瞬间。然后我看到小宇从他的卧室里走出来,我们相识一笑,不知为何往日快乐瞬间涌上心头,但同时也夹杂着一丝惆怅。我们确实都长大了。然后,我们也回不去了。现在事情也不再那么简单了。我们坐在阳台上,聊起了小时候的趣事。他提起我们曾经一起在小河边捉鱼,剩下的午后缠身阵阵。我忍不住笑出声,但那一刻我又感到一丝难过。时间过去了,我们再也无法回到那个无忧无虑的年纪。我们现在有各自的学业,各自的事情要为之奔波。我们的生活也不再是一种一样的,我们的生活也不再是一种一样的。我们的生活也不再是一种一样的,我们的生活也不再是一种一样的。我们的生活也不再是一种一样的,我们的生活也不再是一种一样的。我们之间可能也隔着一层可悲的后障壁了。我觉得这个是一个挺可悲的一件事,但是也毫无办法。在告别的时候,我心中突然有一种很复杂的情感,既有重聚的喜悦,但也有对逝去岁月的怀念。这次探访让我明白了,虽然时间改变了一切,但也有对逝去岁月的怀念。这次探访让我明白了,虽然时间改变了一切,但也有对逝去岁月的怀念。但那些美好回忆其实依然留在我心中,成为我生命中不可磨灭的一部分。但那些美好回忆其实依然留在我心中,成为我生命中不可磨灭的一部分。
English_text: On a sunny weekend, I decided to visit my childhood friend Xiaoyu. We haven't seen each other for several years, and my heart is filled with anticipation and tension, and perhaps it's also a longing for him. When I walked into his house, I almost felt the atmosphere of playing together back then. Our people here call friends who have been playing from childhood to adulthood 'hairless'. This feeling is very wonderful, it was when we grew up watching each other from a young age. The photos on the wall still capture countless happy moments of our time. Then I saw Xiaoyu walk out of his bedroom, and we met with a smile. For some reason, our past happiness suddenly surged in our hearts, but at the same time, there was also a hint of melancholy mixed in. We have indeed all grown up. And then, we can't go back either. Things are no longer that simple now. We sat on the balcony and talked about some funny stories from our childhood. He mentioned that we used to catch fish together by the small river, and the rest of the afternoon was filled with waves. I couldn't help but laugh out loud, but at that moment, I felt a hint of sadness. Time has passed, and we can never go back to that carefree age. We now have our own studies and tasks to attend to. Our lives are no longer the same, and our lives are no longer the same. Our lives are no longer the same, and our lives are no longer the same. Our lives are no longer the same, and our lives are no longer the same. There may also be a sad barrier between us. I think this is a rather sad thing, but there's nothing I can do about it. As I bid farewell, I suddenly felt a complex emotion in my heart, both the joy of reunion and the nostalgia for the past. This visit made me understand that although time has changed everything, there are also memories of the past. This visit made me understand that although time has changed everything, there are also memories of the past. But those beautiful memories still remain in my heart, becoming an indelible part of my life. But those beautiful memories still remain in my heart, becoming an indelible part of my life.
Extracted_Text: 在一个阳光明媚的周末,我决定去探望我小时候的好朋友小宇。我们已经有好几年没有见面了,心中充满了期待和紧张,还有就是可能也是对他的一种想念吧。当我走进他家时,几乎感受到当年一块玩的气息。我们这的人管这样从小玩到大的朋友叫发小。这种感觉十分奇妙,就是当年从小互相看着对方一起长大的。墙上的照片依旧定格着我们那个时候无数快乐的瞬间。然后我看到小宇从他的卧室里走出来,我们相识一笑,不知为何往日快乐瞬间涌上心头,但同时也夹杂着一丝惆怅。我们确实都长大了。然后,我们也回不去了。现在事情也不再那么简单了。我们坐在阳台上,聊起了小时候的趣事。他提起我们曾经一起在小河边捉鱼,剩下的午后缠身阵阵。我忍不住笑出声,但那一刻我又感到一丝难过。时间过去了,我们再也无法回到那个无忧无虑的年纪。我们现在有各自的学业,各自的事情要为之奔波。我们的生活也不再是一种一样的,我们的生活也不再是一种一样的。我们的生活也不再是一种一样的,我们的生活也不再是一种一样的。我们的生活也不再是一种一样的,我们的生活也不再是一种一样的。我们之间可能也隔着一层可悲的后障壁了。我觉得这个是一个挺可悲的一件事,但是也毫无办法。在告别的时候,我心中突然有一种很复杂的情感,既有重聚的喜悦,但也有对逝去岁月的怀念。这次探访让我明白了,虽然时间改变了一切,但也有对逝去岁月的怀念。这次探访让我明白了,虽然时间改变了一切,但也有对逝去岁月的怀念。但那些美好回忆其实依然留在我心中,成为我生命中不可磨灭的一部分。但那些美好回忆其实依然留在我心中,成为我生命中不可磨灭的一部分。

Chinese_text: 去年,我去了意大利的威尼斯旅行,这是我梦寐以求的旅行,终于有机会亲自感受这座水上城市的魅力。我和几个朋友一起踏上了这趟旅程,刚到这座城市时,我们都被眼前的景色深深震撼。威尼斯的街道并不是传统意义上的街道,28年的水道,环绕着古老的建筑,宛如进入历史的画卷。我们迫不及待地坐上了宫多拉这种传统的威尼斯小船,缓缓地穿行在水道上。船夫熟练地滑动着脚,带领我们穿过那些有厚重历史感的建筑群。水面上倒映着夕阳的余晖,给周围的景色增添了几分金色的光辉,这座城市显得宁静而神秘。除了多宫多拉之旅,我们还参观了圣马克广场,这是威尼斯最著名的广场之一,广场上人生顶废。城市圈的鸽子在空中飞翔,不时落在地上,吸引游客们为食。广场周围是行尾的建筑,圣马克教堂的金色连顶在阳光下,熠熠生辉。在圣马克工厂上,我们遇到了一位画游客肖像的艺术家。我让他为我画了一幅肖像,艺术家微笑地敬服了请求,开始细致地描绘。广场周围是行尾的建筑,圣马克教堂的金色连顶在阳光下,熠熠生辉。画室充满了咖啡的香气和悠扬的音乐,我在静静等待着。画完后,艺术家递给我那幅肖像,画中的我看起来比真实的我更加生动而有趣。这次偶遇给我留下了深刻的印象。在这座历史悠久的城市,所有的瞬间都带着神秘的色彩,尤其是那些不经意间发生的插曲。它让旅行变得更加真实和难忘。
English_text: Last year, I went on a trip to Venice, Italy, which was my dream trip. Finally, I had the opportunity to personally experience the charm of this water city. I embarked on this journey with a few friends, and when we first arrived in this city, we were deeply impressed by the scenery before us. The streets of Venice are not in the traditional sense, with 28 year old waterways surrounding ancient buildings, like a painting of history. We eagerly boarded the traditional Venetian boat, the Gondola, and slowly sailed through the waterway. The boatman skillfully slid his feet, leading us through the complex of buildings with a strong sense of history. The water reflects the afterglow of the sunset, adding a touch of golden radiance to the surrounding scenery, making the city appear peaceful and mysterious. In addition to the Duogong Dora tour, we also visited St. Mark's Square, one of the most famous squares in Venice, where people live in ruins. Pigeons in the city circle fly in the air and occasionally land on the ground, attracting tourists for food. The square is surrounded by buildings at the end of the line, and the golden roof of St. Mark's Church shines brightly in the sunlight. At the St. Mark's factory, we met an artist who painted portraits of tourists. I asked him to paint a portrait of me, and the artist smiled respectfully at the request and began to depict it in detail. The square is surrounded by buildings at the end of the line, and the golden roof of St. Mark's Church shines brightly in the sunlight. The studio is filled with the aroma of coffee and melodious music, and I am quietly waiting. After finishing the painting, the artist handed me the portrait, in which I looked more vivid and interesting than the real me. This encounter left a deep impression on me. In this city with a long history, all moments carry a mysterious color, especially those that happen unintentionally. It makes travel more real and unforgettable.

Chinese_text: 在2021年的秋天,我去探望了一位很久没见的朋友小军。小军是我大学时期最好的朋友,我们一起度过了很多美好的时光,在那时我们常常一起摇曳复习,讨论人生理想,梦想着毕业后能一起传达世界,然而毕业后我们各自走上了不同的道路,慢慢地失去了联系,每当我想到他总有些遗憾,但我们都知道,生活总是把人带得越来越远。直到有一天,我收到了他家人的消息,说小军得了重病,情况非常不好。听到这个消息,我内心充满了无助和焦虑,决定尽快去看他。我到达小军家时,看到他躺在病床上,手都几乎认不出来,虽然他勉强笑了笑,但眼神里透出了深深疲惫。我们坐在他的病床前,聊起了我们以前一起度过的那些时光,他轻轻地说,他一直在等我来看他,因为他知道我不会抛下他,那一刻,我感到心里像有一块石头压着,无法呼吸。小军递给我一本笔记本,说这是他这段时间写的,里面记录了他的过去的回忆,对我们的友谊,以及他对未来的无奈。他说,如果有一天他自己离开了,希望我能记住他,也记住曾经那些美好。听到这些话,我几乎控制不住眼泪,然而我只能尽力表现坚强,想象着说,你一定会好起来的。那天晚上,我们并肩坐在院子里,听着远处的钟声和风声,空气有些冷,但他依然不想我走,拉着我不放,我答应他下次不会回来再看他。然而再见的时候,我已经再也没有机会对他说那句你一定会好起来的话了。几个月后,小军去世了,我收到消息时心中空落落的,仿佛失去了一个永远无法嫁回来的朋友。我打开他留意的桌子,我拿着我的笔记本,读着那些文字,仿佛他在我身边,一切都那么真实,却又那么遥远。每当我看到那些关于他聊些的事,心中都会涌上阵阵痛楚,也许,我们总是在失去后才能珍惜。
English_text: In the autumn of 2021, I visited a long lost friend named Xiao Jun. Xiao Jun was my best friend during my college years, and we spent many wonderful times together. At that time, we often swayed and reviewed together, discussed our life ideals, and dreamed of conveying the world together after graduation. However, after graduation, we each embarked on different paths and gradually lost touch. Every time I think of him, I feel a little regretful, but we all know that life always takes people further and further away. Until one day, I received a message from his family that Xiao Jun had fallen seriously ill and his condition was very bad. Upon hearing this news, my heart was filled with helplessness and anxiety, and I decided to go see him as soon as possible. When I arrived at Xiaojun's house, I saw him lying on the sickbed with almost unrecognizable hands. Although he forced a smile, there was a deep exhaustion in his eyes. We sat in front of his hospital bed, chatting about the time we spent together before. He gently said that he had been waiting for me to come and see him because he knew I wouldn't abandon him. At that moment, I felt like a stone pressing down on my heart, unable to breathe. Xiao Jun handed me a notebook and said it was written by him during this period, which recorded his past memories, his friendship with us, and his helplessness towards the future. He said that if one day he left on his own, I hope I can remember him and also remember those beautiful moments from the past. Upon hearing these words, I could hardly control my tears, but I could only try my best to appear strong and imagine saying, 'You will definitely get better.'. That night, we sat side by side in the yard, listening to the distant bell and wind. The air was a bit cold, but he still didn't want me to leave and held me back. I promised him that I wouldn't come back to see him again next time. However, when we said goodbye, I never had the chance to say to him the words' you will definitely get better 'again. A few months later, Xiaojun passed away. When I received the news, my heart was empty, as if I had lost a friend who could never be married back. I opened the table he was paying attention to, holding my notebook and reading those words as if he were beside me, everything so real yet so distant. Every time I see those things I talk about him, my heart surges with pain. Perhaps we can only cherish them after losing them.

Chinese_text: 小时候,我一直生活在内陆城市,那里群山环绕,河流虽多,但从未见过真正的大海。在我心中,海是一个梦,一个充满蓝色和浪花的世界。去年暑假,我和朋友们计划了一次去海南的旅行,终于有机会实现了这个梦。当飞机降落在三亚机场时,我迫不及待地想奔向海边。第二天清晨,我们早早起床,驱车前往三亚湾。当车子接近海岸线时,我看到一片深蓝色的海洋出现在眼前。它的广阔与平静让我屏住了呼吸,阳光洒在海面上,像是铺了一层金粉。我和朋友们迫不及待地下了车,踩在柔软的沙滩上,感受着沙子从纸粪间滑过的细腻触感。但在海滩边,我第一次听到了真实的海浪声,那种声音既磅礴又轻柔,像是大自然的交响乐。朋友们一边欢呼一边冲向海水,我也卷起裤腿,小心翼翼地走进去。凉凉的海水浸湿了我的脚踝,浪花轻轻拍打着皮肤,带来一种无法形容的快乐和新奇感。我们还租了一艘小船出海,船长告诉我们,海域附近经常能看到海豚,果然在海面上航行了一会儿后,远处跳跃的几只海豚吸引了我们的目光,大家激动地叫了起来,争先恐后地拿起手机拍照。那天,我们还尝试了沙滩排球和抓螃蟹,每一刻都充满了欢笑和兴奋。夜幕降临时,我们坐在沙滩上看日落,橘红色的夕阳将海水染成了金黄,景色美得让我不愿离开。这次第一次见到海的经历,我用了一张照片给我的记忆,画了一幅永远不褪色的画卷。
English_text: When I was a child, I lived in an inland city surrounded by mountains and rivers, but I had never seen the real sea. In my heart, the sea is a dream, a world full of blue and waves. Last summer, my friends and I planned a trip to Hainan and finally had the opportunity to fulfill our dream. When the plane landed at Sanya Airport, I couldn't wait to head towards the beach. The next morning, we woke up early and drove to Sanya Bay. As the car approached the coastline, I saw a deep blue ocean appear before my eyes. Its vastness and calmness made me hold my breath, and the sunlight sprinkled on the sea, like a layer of golden powder. My friends and I couldn't wait to get off the car and step on the soft beach, feeling the delicate touch of sand sliding through the paper manure. But by the beach, I heard the real sound of waves for the first time, which was both majestic and gentle, like a symphony of nature. My friends cheered while rushing towards the sea, and I rolled up my pants and cautiously walked in. The cool seawater soaked my ankles, and the waves gently brushed against my skin, bringing an indescribable sense of joy and novelty. We also rented a small boat to go out to sea, and the captain told us that dolphins can often be seen near the sea. After sailing on the sea for a while, several dolphins jumping in the distance caught our attention, and everyone excitedly shouted and eagerly picked up their phones to take photos. That day, we also tried beach volleyball and crab catching, and every moment was filled with laughter and excitement. As night fell, we sat on the beach watching the sunset. The orange red sunset dyed the sea golden, and the scenery was so beautiful that I didn't want to leave. The first time I saw the sea, I used a photo to give my memory and painted a picture that will never fade.

Chinese_text: 今天夏天举行了世界杯,我支持的球队是德国。德国最近几年的表现一直不是很好,所以外界普遍并不是看好他们。但是我还是支持德国队,因为德国队有很多我喜欢的球员,并且我从十年前就开始支持德国队了。在今天小组赛中,德国队第一场输掉了同组的非常强大的西班牙队。这让德国队的球迷都蒙上了一层阴影。但是后续的两场,德国队联克日本和比利时两支队伍最终成功以小组第二晋级出现。在八强淘汰赛上,德国队的小组第二面对的是另一组的小组第一阿根廷。在四强比赛中,德国队以4比0的比分最终结束了比赛。这个比分无疑是打了很多不看好德国队人的球迷的脸,因为德国队以一场非常漂亮的胜利晋级到了八强。然后在四强比赛中,德国队又2比1战胜了夺冠的热门巴西队。成功停顿。在半决赛中,德国队占上了小组曾经输给过的西班牙队,最终停顿了决赛。这让很多人都认为德国队是这次世界杯的一只黑马。但我认为德国队只是展现出了他正常的实力而已。在决赛上,德国队面对的是曾经的世界杯霸主意大利队。但是意大利队这几年,他们的技术也有所下滑。在面对德国队的猛烈进攻下,意大利队最终是以0比3输掉的比赛。德国队终于捧起了久违的大力神杯,获得了这次世界杯的冠军。这让我非常开心,因为我支持的是德国队,他获得了冠军,我就非常开心。所以这就是我的故事。
English_text: The World Cup was held this summer, and the team I support is Germany. Germany's performance in recent years has not been very good, so the outside world generally does not have a positive outlook on them. But I still support the German team because they have many players that I like, and I have been supporting them since ten years ago. In today's group stage, the German team lost their first game to the very strong Spanish team in the same group. This has cast a shadow over the fans of the German team. However, in the following two matches, the German team, along with Japan and Belgium, ultimately advanced to the second place in the group stage. In the knockout stage of the quarter finals, the German team's second group match is against the other group's first placed Argentina. In the semifinals, the German team ultimately ended the game with a score of 4-0. This score undoubtedly put many fans who were not optimistic about the German team in the face, as the German team advanced to the quarter finals with a very beautiful victory. Then in the semifinals, the German team defeated the popular Brazilian team 2-1 to win the championship. Successfully paused. In the semi-finals, the German team took over the group that had previously lost to the Spanish team, and ultimately came to a halt in the final. This makes many people believe that the German team is a dark horse in this World Cup. But I think the German team just showed their normal strength. In the final, the German team faced the former World Cup champions Italy. But in recent years, the Italian team's skills have also declined. Faced with the fierce attack of the German team, the Italian team ultimately lost the game 0-3. The German team finally lifted the long-awaited World Cup trophy and won the championship. This makes me very happy because I support the German team and they won the championship, which makes me very happy. So this is my story.
Extracted_Text: 今天夏天举行了世界杯,我支持的球队是德国。德国最近几年的表现一直不是很好,所以外界普遍并不是看好他们。但是我还是支持德国队,因为德国队有很多我喜欢的球员,并且我从十年前就开始支持德国队了。在今天小组赛中,德国队第一场输掉了同组的非常强大的西班牙队。这让德国队的球迷都蒙上了一层阴影。但是后续的两场,德国队联克日本和比利时两支队伍最终成功以小组第二晋级出现。在八强淘汰赛上,德国队的小组第二面对的是另一组的小组第一阿根廷。在四强比赛中,德国队以4比0的比分最终结束了比赛。这个比分无疑是打了很多不看好德国队人的球迷的脸,因为德国队以一场非常漂亮的胜利晋级到了八强。然后在四强比赛中,德国队又2比1战胜了夺冠的热门巴西队。成功停顿。在半决赛中,德国队占上了小组曾经输给过的西班牙队,最终停顿了决赛。这让很多人都认为德国队是这次世界杯的一只黑马。但我认为德国队只是展现出了他正常的实力而已。在决赛上,德国队面对的是曾经的世界杯霸主意大利队。但是意大利队这几年,他们的技术也有所下滑。在面对德国队的猛烈进攻下,意大利队最终是以0比3输掉的比赛。德国队终于捧起了久违的大力神杯,获得了这次世界杯的冠军。这让我非常开心,因为我支持的是德国队,他获得了冠军,我就非常开心。所以这就是我的故事。

Chinese_text: 几年前,我去了欧洲旅行,特地选择了法国巴黎。巴黎是我一直向往的城市,充满了浪漫的气息和浓厚的艺术氛围。那是一个阳光明媚的下午,我决定去探索市区,享受这座城市的魅力。然而,由于没有提前做好充足的路线规划,我在陌生的街道上迷路了,手机也因为电量耗尽而无法使用。更糟糕的是,我一点也不懂法语,所以不知道如何与当地人沟通。我站在路边有些慌张,不知道该怎么办。正当我心里焦急时,一个中年男子走到我面前,他看起来非常友善,穿着简单的衣服,面带微笑。他看到我有些迷茫,就主动走上前询问我是否需要帮助。看到他的笑容,我感到一丝安心,于是我告诉他我迷路了,手机也没电了,根本找不到回酒店的路。他听后微笑着说,"没问题,跟我来吧。这个陌生人没有丝毫犹豫,毫不犹豫地决定帮助我。他带着我走到附近的一家咖啡馆,给我充电,并用简单的手势和英语告诉我怎么乘地铁回到酒店。他甚至为了为我买了一杯咖啡。陪我坐下来聊了起来。虽然我们之间语言不通,但通过肢体语言和微笑,我们成功地建立了沟通。这一刻,我感觉自己不再是一个孤单的游客,而是受到了他人温暖的关怀。通过这次经历,我深刻体会到人与人之间的善意是跨越文化和语言的。有时候,一个陌生人的一个微笑和善举,可以让我们感到无比的温暖和踏实。那位陌生人不仅帮助我解决了问题,还让我重新相信。在陌生的环境中,人与人之间的友好是可以轻松建立的。
English_text: A few years ago, I traveled to Europe and specifically chose Paris, France. Paris is the city I have always longed for, full of romantic atmosphere and strong artistic atmosphere. It was a sunny afternoon, and I decided to explore the city and enjoy its charm. However, due to insufficient route planning in advance, I got lost on a strange street and my phone ran out of battery. Even worse, I don't understand French at all, so I don't know how to communicate with the locals. I stood on the roadside feeling a bit flustered and didn't know what to do. Just as I was feeling anxious, a middle-aged man walked up to me. He looked very friendly, wearing simple clothes and smiling. He saw that I was a bit confused, so he took the initiative to step forward and ask if I needed help. Seeing his smile, I felt a little relieved, so I told him that I was lost and my phone was out of battery, so I couldn't find my way back to the hotel. After hearing this, he smiled and said, 'No problem, come with me.' This stranger didn't hesitate at all and decided to help me. He took me to a nearby caf é, charged me, and told me how to take the subway back to the hotel with simple gestures and English. He even bought me a cup of coffee. He sat down with me to chat. Although we didn't speak the same language, we successfully established communication through body language and smiles. At this moment, I felt no longer a lonely tourist, but received warm care from others. Through this experience, I deeply realized that goodwill between people transcends culture and language. Sometimes, a A smile and kindness from a stranger can make us feel incredibly warm and grounded. That stranger not only helped me solve the problem, but also made me believe again. Friendship between people can be easily established in unfamiliar environments.

Chinese_text: 在2017年,我回了趟老家。在第一天,我们去了一个老爷爷家里做客。在交谈中得知,老爷爷的毛笔字写得特别好。我一听,听到这个消息,我便产生了极大的兴趣。老爷爷见我如此感兴趣,便兴致勃勃地领着我去他的书房里面参观。我一进去,便看到墙上有很多漂亮且恢宏的字迹挂在上面。我被惊讶到张大了嘴,并且不禁发出了感慨。我也想写出这么好看的字。老爷爷随即便拿出一张宣纸。我便写了一张宣纸,并且不禁写得起来。只见他气势如虎,下笔十分果断且有认知。在哈哈大笑几声之后,便写出了几个字来。我仔细一看,发现嘴上写着学无止境四个大字。这时,老爷爷便语重心长地对我说道,人生路上学无止境。你应该在生活的各个方面,包括对于知识的获取,个人修养的提升等等等等,都应该始终保持着谦逊、好学的态度。不能骄傲自满,应该持续地去追求更多的知识和更高的境界。就像我一样。我一直在学习。就像我写毛笔字一样。我每天多写一幅画,都会对我带来多一种的感动。永远都会有新的东西等待你去学习和发现。我现如今,能写成这么优秀的字体,离不开我一天天的学习。直到现在,我仍在不断学习,不断进步。说吧,老爷便把那幅字送给了我。这件事也让我感触十分深刻,也让我下定了决心好好学习,天天向上。这件事也让我感触十分深刻,也让我下定了决心好好学习,天天向上。
English_text: In 2017, I went back to my hometown. On the first day, we visited an old man's house as guests. During the conversation, I learned that the old man's calligraphy is particularly good. As soon as I heard this news, I became extremely interested. The old master saw how interested I was and enthusiastically led me to visit his study. As soon as I entered, I saw many beautiful and magnificent handwriting hanging on the wall. I was so surprised that I opened my mouth wide and couldn't help but sigh. I also want to write such beautiful words. The old man immediately took out a piece of rice paper. I wrote a piece of rice paper and couldn't help but start writing. I saw him with a tiger like aura, writing very decisively and with recognition. After laughing heartily a few times, he wrote a few words. I took a closer look and found the four big characters' Learning Without End 'written on my mouth. At this moment, the old man spoke earnestly to me, 'There is no end to learning on the road of life.'. You should always maintain a humble and studious attitude in all aspects of life, including acquiring knowledge, improving personal cultivation, and so on. We should not be arrogant or complacent, but continue to pursue more knowledge and higher realms. Just like me. I have been studying all along. Just like how I write calligraphy with a brush. Writing an extra painting every day brings me an extra sense of emotion. There will always be new things waiting for you to learn and discover. I cannot write such excellent fonts today without my daily learning. Until now, I am still constantly learning and making progress. Speak up, the master gave me that word. This incident also deeply touched me and made me determined to study hard and make progress every day. This incident also deeply touched me and made me determined to study hard and make progress every day.

Chinese_text: 在十一长假期间,我们一个宿舍打算前往日本去旅行,心中满载了对内政事件的期待和好奇。这也是我首次远行出国,护照作为我身份的象征自然被我视为最重要的行李,小心翼翼地保管着。当我们抵达了东京成田机场后,我迅速就被这座城市的繁华与活力吸引了。从前草寺的宁静到色谷的喧嚣,每一处都充满了探索的魅力。我沉浸在购物的乐趣中,尤其是在秋叶园。那里的电子产品和动漫周边让我流连忘返,尤其是我最喜欢的柯南。然而,就在我满载而归,准备返回位于心虚的旅馆的时候,不幸来了。在回到旅馆的路上,我未曾察觉到背包的拉链已经被绑紧了。我被悄然拉开,直到准备办理入住的时候,才发现护照连同一些现金还有随身物品都已经丢失了。在那一刻,我的心简直被恐惧和焦虑完全的占领。没有护照,那么就意味着我接下来的旅行将会陷入困境。我虚似地冷静了下来,向前台进行求助。他们不仅提供了安慰,而且迅速帮我联系了当地的警察局。在警方的协助下,我便开始找到他们的家人。我开始了反锁的报案流程。同时,我也通过中国驻日本大使馆的紧急联系方式去求帮助。大使馆的工作人员非常专业,他们指导我如何准备相关材料,并告诉我不办旅行证件的具体步骤。在等待新旅行证件的日子里,我不得不暂时中断了原定的旅行计划,留在东京。虽然这让我感到沮丧,但我也因此有机会更加深入地体验当地的生活。我与来自世界各地的旅客交流了很长时间的时间。这段经历让我收获了不一样的友谊和感恩。经过几天的努力,我终于拿到了临时的护照,得以继续我的日本之旅。虽然护照丢失的这件事让我非常害怕,但是它也教会了我一个重要的教训,就是无论是在何处,安全意识完全不能放松。这次经历虽然充满了波折,但也成为了我人生旅途中一段路。但也成为了我人生旅途中一段路。但也成为了我人生旅途中一段路。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后三个书中找到一个书说的中心。最后三个书说的中心。请不吝点赞 订阅 转发 打赏支持明镜与点点栏目
English_text: During the National Day holiday, our dormitory planned to travel to Japan, filled with anticipation and curiosity about domestic affairs. This is also my first time traveling abroad, and my passport, as a symbol of my identity, is naturally regarded as my most important luggage, carefully kept. When we arrived at Tokyo Narita Airport, I was quickly drawn to the hustle and bustle of the city. From the tranquility of Qiancao Temple to the hustle and bustle of Sekigaya, every place is filled with the charm of exploration. I am immersed in the joy of shopping, especially in Akihabara. The electronic products and anime merchandise there made me linger, especially my favorite Conan. However, just as I was returning home with a full load, preparing to return to the hotel located in a state of guilt, misfortune came. On the way back to the hotel, I didn't realize that the zipper of my backpack was already tied tightly. I was quietly pulled away until I was about to check in, only to find that my passport, along with some cash and personal belongings, had been lost. At that moment, my heart was completely occupied by fear and anxiety. Without a passport, it means my next trip will be in trouble. I calmed down in a virtual state and sought help from the front stage. They not only provided comfort, but also quickly helped me contact the local police station. With the assistance of the police, I began to locate their families. I have started the anti lock reporting process. At the same time, I also sought help through the emergency contact information of the Chinese Embassy in Japan. The embassy staff are very professional, they guided me on how to prepare relevant materials and told me the specific steps for not obtaining travel documents. During the days waiting for new travel documents, I had to temporarily interrupt my original travel plan and stay in Tokyo. Although it made me feel frustrated, it also gave me the opportunity to experience local life more deeply. I have been communicating with travelers from all over the world for a long time. This experience has given me a different kind of friendship and gratitude. After several days of hard work, I finally obtained a temporary passport and was able to continue my trip to Japan. Although the loss of my passport made me very scared, it also taught me an important lesson that I cannot relax my security awareness no matter where I am. Although this experience was full of twists and turns, it also became a part of my life journey. But it also became a part of my life journey. But it also became a part of my life journey. Finally, return to school within the designated time. Finally, return to school within the designated time. Finally, return to school within the designated time. Finally, return to school within the designated time. Find the center of one of the last three books. The center of the last three books. Extracted_Text: 在十一长假期间,我们一个宿舍打算前往日本去旅行,心中满载了对内政事件的期待和好奇。这也是我首次远行出国,护照作为我身份的象征自然被我视为最重要的行李,小心翼翼地保管着。当我们抵达了东京成田机场后,我迅速就被这座城市的繁华与活力吸引了。从前草寺的宁静到色谷的喧嚣,每一处都充满了探索的魅力。我沉浸在购物的乐趣中,尤其是在秋叶园。那里的电子产品和动漫周边让我流连忘返,尤其是我最喜欢的柯南。然而,就在我满载而归,准备返回位于心虚的旅馆的时候,不幸来了。在回到旅馆的路上,我未曾察觉到背包的拉链已经被绑紧了。我被悄然拉开,直到准备办理入住的时候,才发现护照连同一些现金还有随身物品都已经丢失了。在那一刻,我的心简直被恐惧和焦虑完全的占领。没有护照,那么就意味着我接下来的旅行将会陷入困境。我虚似地冷静了下来,向前台进行求助。他们不仅提供了安慰,而且迅速帮我联系了当地的警察局。在警方的协助下,我便开始找到他们的家人。我开始了反锁的报案流程。同时,我也通过中国驻日本大使馆的紧急联系方式去求帮助。大使馆的工作人员非常专业,他们指导我如何准备相关材料,并告诉我不办旅行证件的具体步骤。在等待新旅行证件的日子里,我不得不暂时中断了原定的旅行计划,留在东京。虽然这让我感到沮丧,但我也因此有机会更加深入地体验当地的生活。我与来自世界各地的旅客交流了很长时间的时间。这段经历让我收获了不一样的友谊和感恩。经过几天的努力,我终于拿到了临时的护照,得以继续我的日本之旅。虽然护照丢失的这件事让我非常害怕,但是它也教会了我一个重要的教训,就是无论是在何处,安全意识完全不能放松。这次经历虽然充满了波折,但也成为了我人生旅途中一段路。但也成为了我人生旅途中一段路。但也成为了我人生旅途中一段路。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后在规定的时间内回到学校。最后三个书中找到一个书说的中心。最后三个书说的中心。请不吝点赞 订阅 转发 打赏支持明镜与点点栏目

Chinese_text: 当我去上海的时候,我正在上大学,就是前年吧,前年我刚上大学的时候,我一个人独自去的上海。当时我就是心血来潮,想一个人去,上海是一个大城市,然后我也从来没有去过,我想亲自去感受一下。我是坐卧铺去的,从北京,当时我还在上学,还在学期中,所以我坐卧铺,一个人去了上海,然后我去参观了很多景点。上海是一个大城市,但它也有很多景点,主要我还是想感受一下就是这种大城市的感觉,对,就是大城市的感觉。去到那里,我发现真的是很不一样的感觉,上海的建筑是特别的高,也特别密集,比北京都要高。然后那里的人,我感觉他们带给我一种就是很潮流,而且很有新时代的一种感觉。然后在那里,我还结识了一位朋友,他是一个年纪稍比我大的人。是一个女性,她是一个,她跟我说她是一个,就是在时尚,跟时尚杂志有关系,她在那里工作的一个女性。然后她大概二十几岁,快到三十岁,比我大几岁。我们是在那个一个服装店认识的,然后她就看见我的包,因为我的包,就是我小小的装饰了一下,然后我们就开始攀谈。然后那天,她还带我去了一个上海的酒吧,然后在那里,我还跟她的很多朋友也结识了一下。就是他们都是很潮的一些人,很时尚的一些人。就在那里,她请我喝了几杯酒,然后我真的感觉很快乐,因为就是让我感觉到一种很自然的感觉。就是让我感觉到一种很自然的感觉。就是让我感觉到一种很自然的感觉。自由,很多元的一种文化在上海。但是之后我们也没有留下什么联系方式,就是就这样子。就那天下午,那天晚上喝完酒以后,我就跟她告别了,就又开始了我的一个人的旅行。我去了那儿就是两三天的样子,大概三天吧。就是抱。加上我坐车的时间。但是上海我感觉物价很贵。我在那里想吃一碗面条,我得要三十块钱。不像在我家里,也不像在北京。比北京还要贵那里的物价。但是我很喜欢这座城市。我一个人在这里度过了两三天旅行。这是一个很特别的经历。我。既激动,也有一种很自由的感觉。很充实的感觉。有一种别样的感觉。
English_text: When I went to Shanghai, I was in college two years ago. When I first started college two years ago, I went to Shanghai alone. At that time, I had a sudden impulse to go alone. Shanghai is a big city, and I had never been there before. I wanted to personally experience it. I went by sleeper from Beijing when I was still in school and in the middle of the semester, so I took a sleeper and went to Shanghai alone. Then I visited many scenic spots. Shanghai is a big city, but it also has many attractions. Mainly, I want to experience the feeling of a big city, yes, the feeling of a big city. When I went there, I found a really different feeling. The buildings in Shanghai are particularly tall and dense, taller than those in Beijing. And the people there, I feel like they give me a trendy and modern vibe. Then there, I also made a friend who was slightly older than me. She is a woman, and she told me that she is a woman who works in fashion and has connections with fashion magazines. Then she was probably in her twenties, almost thirty years old, a few years older than me. We met at that clothing store, and then she saw my bag because it was my little decoration, and we started chatting. And that day, she also took me to a bar in Shanghai, where I met many of her friends. They are all very trendy and fashionable people. Right there, she treated me to a few drinks, and I really felt happy because it made me feel a very natural feeling. It just makes me feel a very natural feeling. It just makes me feel a very natural feeling. Freedom is a very diverse culture in Shanghai. But we didn't leave any contact information afterwards, that's all. That afternoon, after finishing my drink that night, I said goodbye to her and started my solo journey again. I went there for two or three days, about three days. It's just hugging. Plus the time I spent in the car. But I feel that prices are very expensive in Shanghai. I want to eat a bowl of noodles there, I need thirty yuan. It's not like at home, nor is it like in Beijing. Prices there are even more expensive than in Beijing. But I really like this city. I spent two or three days traveling here alone. This is a very special experience. I. I am both excited and have a feeling of freedom. A very fulfilling feeling. There is a different feeling.

Chinese_text: 吴周渡、鸡鸣石山、篆会总部在藏身处的角落里，有一个乍一看很原始的小阁楼。桌子上放着零散的文件和电子设备，一张热身沙发和一些漂浮的衣物短缺部件，形成了一个简单的卫生间。然而，角落里的书架实际上是一扇移动安全门。当我的前辈打开它时，它显示了一条通往地下的通道。当藏身之处就在里面时，这更像是一个计划中的垃圾柜台，而不是一个地下室。中心有三个垃圾桶。当我走近他们时，我看到了一张未绘制的城市地图，它被分成了各种各样的衣服，就像一个复杂的棋盘。所以，这是你的欣赏中心。对地球的思考不仅是岛民的联系点，也是我们的家园。你看到的电脑和屏幕是我们用来收集和利用信息的工具。看，这是边境管制的正确区域，他们在这里进行各种非法活动，包括销售网络、增强功能和重击武器。侥幸区域。另一方面，这是一个毫无价值的操作领域。我们努力下订单的地方。我以前从未见过这么多高科技设备。顺便问一下，为什么边境房子也在这里？你是什么意思，为什么它也在这里？边防总部就在这里。听说监狱安全部门最近爬下了那里的一个大厅。逮捕了许多关键成员，他们在那里严重觉醒。但这座未划定城市的边境首领是狡猾的冠军杜康。我听说边境众议院总统已经躲藏了很长时间。也许这是先知的阴茎，他的目标是权力。

With scattered documents and an electronic device on the table, a warm-up sofa and a few float clothing shortage components forming a simple restroom. However, the bookshelf in the corner is actually a mobile security door. When my senior opens it, it reveals a passage leading underground. As I approach them, I see the map of a non-drawn city divided into various clothes, resembling a complex chessboard. So, this is your appreciation center. And I have heard that the border house president has been in hiding for a long time. Perhaps this is the prophet's penis and he aims right to power.

Chinese_text: 去年秋天，我和朋友们去了杭州。这是我第一次去那里，我非常兴奋。杭州以西湖而闻名，所以我们第一天早上就去了那里。湖很美，远处有山，水面上漂浮着小船。空气清新，景色宛如池塘。我们租了一艘小船，欣赏着宁静的风景。船夫给我们讲了关于那个湖的故事，就像白蛇的传说。听到这个消息很有趣。下午，我们参观了杭州。我们参观了灵隐寺。这座寺庙很安静，充满了历史。瓷砖树环绕着这个地区，空气中弥漫着熏香的味道。在里面，我们看到了许多高跷和古老的亭子。那是一个宁静的地方，我们可以在那里休息。去杭州的旅行既放松又有趣。我会永远记住它的自然美景和美味的食物。
English_text: Last autumn, I visited Hangzhou with my friends. It was my first time there, and I was very excited. Hangzhou is famous for West Lake, so we went there on the first morning. The lake was very beautiful, with mountains in the distance and boats floating on the water. The air was fresh, and the view looked like a pond. We rented a small boat and enjoyed the peaceful scenery. The boatman told us stories about the lake, like the legend of the white snake. It was interesting to hear. In the afternoon, we visited Hangzhou. We visited the Lingyin Temple. The temple was quiet and full of history. Tile trees surrounded the area, and the smell of incense filled the air. Inside, we saw many stilted and old pavilions. It was a peaceful place where we could rest. The trip to Hangzhou was relaxing and fun. I will always remember its natural beauty and delicious food.

Chinese_text: 今年五月，我和一个朋友去香山游玩。北京的夏天很热，但幸运的是那天多云。云层带走了我们的一部分热量，所以我们感觉不太热。香山很美。我们选择了一条陡峭的小路，开始了登山之旅。在许多绿色植物的包围下，我感到氧气充足，我的身体似乎更轻了。在上山的路上，我们边聊天边欣赏风景，感受有氧运动带来的快乐。我们非常高兴。我们很高兴看到美丽的风景。我们很放松，我们想锻炼。当我们到达山顶时，我们在一条长长的小路上找到了一个地方，坐下来休息。许多小麻雀出现在我们面前。我有点惊讶。没想到这么高的山上会有这么多麻雀。这座山很陡。天气很热。风很大。天气很冷。风很大。山。他们似乎也不怕人。一只甚至落在我旁边，轻轻地摇着小手。它非常可爱。然而，下山的路并没有那么容易。走了一会儿，我已经感觉到双腿在发抖。我忍不住说我在日常生活中缺乏锻炼。下山后，我们吃了一顿饭，然后回到了学校。我觉得爬山虽然有点累，但很愉快。
English_text: In May this year, I visited Fragrant Hill with a friend. It's very hot in summer in Beijing, but luckily it was cloudy that day. The clouds took part of the heat of us, so we didn't feel very hot. Fragrant Hill was very beautiful. We chose a steep path and started our mountain climbing journey. Surrounded by many green plants, I felt sufficient oxygen, and my body seemed to be lighter. On the way up to the mountain, we chatted and enjoyed the scenery at the same time, feeling the happiness brought by aerobics. We were very happy. We were excited to see the beautiful scenery. We were very relaxed, and we wanted to exercise. When we reached at the top of the mountain, we found a place on a long path and sat down to rest. Many little sparrows appeared in front of us. I was a little surprised. I didn't expect that there would be so many sparrows on such a high mountain. The mountain was very steep. It was very hot. It was very windy. It was very cold. It was very windy. mountain. They didn't seem to be afraid of people either. One even landed beside me, shaking its little hand lightly. It was very cute. However, the way down to the mountain was not that easy. After walking for a while, I already felt my legs shaking. I couldn't help saying that I lacked exercise in my daily life. After going down to the mountain, we had a meal and then went back to the school. I felt that although climbing the mountain was a little tiring, it was very enjoyable.

Chinese_text: 当我上中学的时候，我参加了一个文化交流项目，这个项目把我带到了美国。这是我第一次出国旅行，我既紧张又兴奋。我们的旅行持续了两周，在这段时间里，我们参观了几个城市、大学和著名的地标。最难忘的经历之一是参观哈佛大学。校园就像我在电影中看到的那样，历史建筑被郁郁葱葱的绿地包围着。我记得站在具有讽刺意味的韦纳图书馆前，拍照，想象在这里学习会是什么样子。在我们的导游之旅中，学生导游分享了引人入胜的故事。他分享了哈佛大学的生活故事，包括传统和学生面临的挑战。另一个难忘的时刻是我们参观了纽约市的时代广场。明亮的灯光、巨大的广告牌和这个地方的纯粹能量令人叹为观止。然而，最有趣的事件之一发生在当地的一次晚餐上，当时我试着点了一份火鸡三明治。我不小心说了鸡肉，当我的订单到达时，我不好意思纠正，所以我很快就吃了。这次旅行不仅是提高英语水平的机会，也是了解美国文化、结识新朋友、走出舒适区的机会。它给我留下了深刻的印象，激发了我的兴趣。我永远珍视我的学生的伯里扬杯苦乐满天飞。让我们与Boruse的Cal Poly公司共同成长
English_text: When I was in middle school, I joined a cultural exchange program that took me to the United States. It was my first time traveling abroad, and I was both nervous and excited. Our trip lasted two weeks, and during that time, we visited several cities, universities, and famous landmarks. One of the most memorable experiences was visiting Harvard University. The campus was exactly like what I have seen in movies, historic buildings surrounded by lush greenery. I remember standing in front of the ironic Weiner Library, taking photos, and imagining what it would be like to study here. During our guide tour, the student guide shared fascinating stories. He shared the stories of life at Harvard, including the traditions and challenges students face. Another unforgettable moment was when we visited Times Square in New York City. The bright lights, giant billboards, and the sheer energy of the place were overwhelming. However, one of the funnest incidents happened at a local dinner when I tried in order a turkey sandwich. I accidentally said chicken instead, and when my order arrived, I was too embarrassed to correct it, so I just ate it quickly. This trip was not only an opportunity to improve my English, but also a chance to learn about American culture, meet new friends, and step out of my comfort zone. Chinese_text: 我想分享一个关于我日常生活的故事。我是一名大学生，我的日子很简单。它们充满了我的梦想和旋律。我的一天从宿舍里的闹钟开始。我迅速起床，梳洗干净，然后冲向图书馆。我喜欢图书馆。这是我一天学习的开始。当我打开书本，沉浸在知识的海洋中时，阳光透过窗户洒在我的桌子上。中午，我和朋友在自助餐厅见面。我们一起吃午饭，分享有趣的故事和学习经历。这些轻松的对话是我一天中快乐的源泉。下午，我通常会参加极限循环活动。有时这是一场篮球比赛。有时是学生会会议。这些活动让我重新回到了大学生活。晚上，我在校园通行证上散步，享受着白天最后的宁静。我用手机捕捉美丽的日落或路边盛开的鲜花。这些简单的时刻是最重要的。我有珍贵的回忆。晚上，我回到宿舍，整理笔记，为第二天的课做准备。睡前，我会花一些时间阅读或写日记，记录一天的细节。故事的最后，我总是在夜晚安静的时候回顾我一天中的每一刻。因此，每一天都显得平凡。我知道，这些旋律优美的日常生活正在编织成我生命中最美丽的场景。
English_text: I want to share a story about my daily life. I'm a college student, and well, my days are simple. They are filled with my dream and melody. My day begins with the alarm clock in my dorm room. I quickly get up, freshen up, and rush to the library. I love to the library. It's where my day of learning starts. Sunlight streams through the windows and spills onto my desk as I open my books and immerse myself in the ocean of knowledge. At noon, I meet up with friends in the cafeteria. We enjoy lunch together while sharing funny stories and learning experiences. These relaxed conversations are the source of joy in my day. In the afternoon, I usually participate in extreme circular activities. Sometimes it's a basketball game. Sometimes it's a student council meeting. These activities re-reach my college life. In the evening, I take a walk on the campus passes, enjoying the last bit of peace in the day. I use my phone to capture the beautiful sunset or newly bloomed flowers by the roadside. These simple moments are the most important. I have precious memories for me. At night, I return to my dorm, organize my notes, and prepare for the next day's classes. Before going to bed, I spend some time reading or writing in my journal, recording the details of the day. At the end of the story, I always look back on my every moment of the day when it's quiet at night. So, each day seems ordinary. I know that these melodic days of daily life are weaving into the most beautiful scene of my life.

Chinese_text: 我去过的最拥挤的地方是北京地铁，尤其是在连顿，尤其是早晚高峰时段。更折磨人的是，我基本上每天都坐地铁旅行。每天早晚，我都会带着一车人挤进地下。地铁是到达那里的最快方式，而且仍然准时。由于北京是一个超级大都市，10年前的常住人口统计不到2000万，流动人口为2000万。所以当你这样想的时候，肯定没有……地铁里肯定没有足够的座位。基本上，在门打开的那一刻，每个人都会回去抢座位。有趣的是，在早晚高峰时段，如果你想上车，有一种有趣的说法，你所要做的就是闭上眼睛，不需要……在挤进车厢之前抬起腿。你不必担心没有扶手，因为有足够多的人让你站起来而不会摔倒。即使你没有抓住其他扶手，因为别人会把你推到一个坚固的地方。然后在早上和晚上，因此，当你应该上气不接下气，但不是很平静的时候，虽然没有迹象表明你现在可以下车了。然后是一个巨大的责任，真的。
English_text: The most crowded place I've ever been is Beijing Underground, especially in Lianton, especially during the morning and evening rush hours. What's more torturous is that I basically traveled by underground every day. Every morning and evening, I squeezed into the underground with a carload of people. The metro is the fastest way to get there and still be on time. Since Beijing is a super metropolis and its resident population was statistically less than 20 million 10 years ago, with a floating population of 20 million. So when you think about it this way, there are definitely no... There are definitely not enough seats in the underground. Basically, everyone goes back and grabs a seat at the moment the door is open. And it is interesting to note that in the morning and evening rush hours, if you try to get into a carriage, there's a funny way to say that all you have to do is close your eyes and you don't need to... to lift your legs before you squeeze into the carriage. And you don't have to worry about the lack of handrails, because there are enough people for you to stand without falling down. Even if you are not holding to other handrails, because others will push you and squeeze you in a firm place. And then in the morning and evening, therefore, when you should be breathless, but not very calm, although there is no sign that you can get out the carriage now. And then there is just a huge responsibilities, really.

Chinese_text: 2022年的冬天，是中国新年，我们一家按照家乡的传统去看望我奶奶的家，那也是我妈妈的家。那天阳光明媚。爸爸、妈妈、哥哥和我开车去了奶奶家，我们互相问候新年。问候过后，妈妈给奶奶家的小朋友们留下了一些红包。。。我们低声告诉他们要努力学习，努力工作。与此同时，我和弟弟也收到了奶奶和叔叔偷偷带的红包。然后我们呆在院子里，沐浴在阳光下，互相聊天。突然，有人提议，嘿，我们来玩扑克吧。我立刻跳起来说，是的，我想玩。所以我很快就拿到了扑克牌。然后我们都开始玩扑克。我们在玩扑克。我们在玩扑克。我们都玩得很开心。
English_text: Winter of 2022, it was Chinese New Year, and our family followed our hometown tradition to visit my grandma's house, which is also my mom's place. The day was bright and sunny. Dad, mom, my brother, and I drove over to grandma's, we exchanged New Year greetings with each other. After the greetings, mom left some red envelopes to the little ones at grandma's. And the time was... We told them to study hard and work hard in a small voice. Meanwhile, my brother and I also got red envelopes, slipped by my grandmother and uncle. Then we stayed in the courtyard, soaking in the sunshine and chatting with each other. Suddenly, someone suggested, hey, let's play some poker. I jumped up right away and said, yes, I want to play. So I quickly got the poker cards. And then we all dived into a game of poker. We were playing poker. We were playing poker. We were all having so much fun.

Chinese_text: 在这个国庆节，我去了武汉东湖，参加我们的住宿活动。当然，这个计划是围绕徒步旅行展开的。东湖的风景很美，非常适合放松散步和深入交谈。至少，一开始，我以为这棵树是这样设计的。第一天中午左右，我们到达了宾馆。有人开始去参加一项遥远的运动，去看日落。听起来很美，所以我们走。我们完全算错了时间和路线。半路上，我们意识到导航应用程序把我们带到了死胡同，迫使我们绕道而行。到那时，我们都快没电了。而且，时间也在滴答作响。我们沿着路走。但只找到了一个共享的背部。但我们有三个人。所以我们让最疲惫的成员继续骑行并买票。幸运的是，我们及时赶到了。这个过程有点困难。但我们做到了。这个过程有点混乱。但当我们终于看到日落时，所有的努力都是值得的。在那次小小的冒险之后，我们来到了一个新的目的地。下一个目的地是太阳城。我们逐渐意识到，我们中没有人真正因为所有的体力劳动而陷入困境。我们真的很想坐下来谈谈。因此，我们其余的活动会转移注意力。我们大部分时间都在宾馆聊天，从中午到午夜，而不是雄心勃勃的计划。中午至午夜。只有当我们充分讨论后，我们才终于满意地回去了。
English_text: On this national holiday, I went to Wuhan, East Lake, to join our stayover activity. Naturally, the plan revolved around hiking. East Lake's scenery is great, perfect for relaxing walks and deep conversations. At least, at the beginning, I thought the tree was designed to be so. We arrived at the guesthouse around noon on the first day. Someone started going for a faraway sport to catch the sunset. That sounds beautiful, so we go. We completely miscalculated the time and the route. On the halfway, we realized the navigation app had led us into a dead end, forcing us to take a long detour. By then, we were all running out of energy. Also, the clock was ticking. We walked along the road. But only finding one shared back. But we have three people. So we let the most exhausted member to cycle ahead and buy the tickets. Fortunately, we arrived in time. The process was a bit difficult. But we made it. The process was a little bit chaotic. But when we finally watched the sunset, all the efforts are worth it. After that little adventure, we come to a new destination. The next destination is the city of the sun. And we come to the realization that none of us were actually caught out for all the physical efforts. We really wanted to sit down and talk. So the rest of our activity shifts focus. Instead of ambitious plans, we spent most of our time in the guesthouse chatting from noon till midnight. . noon till midnight. Only when we fully talked out did we finally head back, thoroughly satisfied.

Chinese_text: 早在2020年，我就去纽约看望我的堂姐。我对这次旅行非常兴奋，因为我已经很多年没见过她了，而且我以前从未去过纽约。我花了数周时间计划一切，从我们要去的地方到我们要尝试的餐馆。但从我降落的那一刻起，事情就开始出错了。首先，我的航班延误了近6个小时，我被困在机场，感到疲倦和烦恼，等待时不知道什么时候可以离开。当我终于到达纽约时，我发现我的行李丢了。我不得不在机场呆了一个多小时，填写表格并与航空公司工作人员交谈，但没有人能告诉我什么时候能找到我的包。当我终于到达堂兄的公寓时，我已经心情不好了。我以为我们吃了一顿丰盛的晚餐，然后聊了聊，但她告诉我那天晚上她必须工作到很晚，所以我独自留在了一个陌生的城市。我点了一些外卖，但不是很好，整个晚上我都感到孤独和沮丧。第二天，我表哥建议我们去中央公园。我想这将是我这次旅行的亮点。我很兴奋能看到这座城市，我很兴奋看到这座城，但我很担心这座城市。我非常担心这座城市，我甚至无法想象这座城市。我非常担心自己会在纽约，也非常担心这座城市，事实上，我剩下的旅程只能靠我的蜜露包，但事实并非如此。我们一到那里，就开始下雨了。我们没有雨伞，所以最后都湿透了。我一直以为这个公园美丽而热闹，但现在却觉得又冷又空。然后，我们发生了争执，因为她认为我对所有事情都持消极态度。我们之间的紧张关系毁了今天剩下的时间。当我飞回家的时候，我完全筋疲力尽，很失望。我花了这么多时间和精力计划这次旅行，但一切都没有按照我希望的方式进行。我迫不及待地想离开，把整件事都忘了。
English_text: Back in 2020, I went to visit my cousin in New York. I had been so excited about this trip because I hadn't seen her in years, and I'd never been to New York before. I spent weeks planning everything, from the places we'd visit to the restaurants we'd try. But from the moment I landed, things started to go wrong. First, my flight was delayed by almost 6 hours, I was stuck at the airport, feeling tired and annoyed, waiting with no clear idea of when I'd get to leave. When I finally arrived in New York, I discovered that my luggage had been lost. I had to spend over an hour at the airport, filling out forms and talking to airline staff, but nobody could tell me when my bag would be found. When I finally got to my cousin's apartment, I was already in a bad mood. I thought we'd had a nice dinner and catch up, but she told me she had to work late that evening, so I was left on my own in a strange city. I ordered some takeout, but it wasn't very good, and I spent the evening feeling lonely and frustrated. The next day, my cousin suggested we visit Central Park. I thought this would be the highlight of my trip. I was so excited to see the city, and I was so excited to see the city, but I was so worried about the city. I was so worried about the city, that I couldn't even imagine the city. I was so worried that I'd be in New York, and I was so worried about the city, and actually my Honeydew bag was all I could strove to for the rest of the trip, but it wasn't. As soon as we got there, it started raining. We didn't have umbrellas, so we ended up getting soaked. The park, which I had always imagined as beautiful and lively just felt cold and empty. Then, we got into an argument because she thought I was being negative about everything. The tension between us ruined the rest of the day. time I flew back home, I was completely exhausted and disappointed. I had spent so much time and effort planning this trip, but nothing had gone the way I had hoped. I couldn't wait to leave and just forget about the whole thing.

Chinese_text: 当我还是个孩子的时候，暑假意味着超越我们的过道，去我祖父母在农村的农舍旅行。对这次访问的期待总是让我兴奋不已，因为我知道这预示着我将从城市生活的压力中解脱出来。我们跨过门槛的那一刻，我受到了新鲜出炉的面包的欢迎。我祖母的围裙系在腰间，总是有一盘温热的饼干等着我。我祖父的手湿漉漉的，脸上带着苍白的笑容，带我参观农场，向我介绍各种动物，从好奇的鸡在地上啄食到在草地上吃草的温和奶牛。农场的日子充满了简单的快乐。我花了几个小时在花园里，帮助我的祖母种植花草蔬菜，学习每种植物的名字。下午，我们经常在院子里的老树旁转悠，爷爷会在那里给我们讲他年轻时的故事。他的声音承载着存在的重量。他心里的话会在我脑海中回响。我彻夜未眠，看着花盛开，花枯萎。我喜欢花园的自然风光、树木和树叶的声音。我会欣赏花园的美丽自然风光。我喜欢花园的自然风光。我喜欢花园的自然风光。夜晚是神奇的，天空变成了一团星星。我的祖父母会搭建一个临时望远镜，我们一起探索宇宙的奇观，梦想着遥远的世界。在我祖父母农舍度过的那些夏日，是一段不幸福的时光。他们教会了我努力工作的价值、大自然的美丽和家庭纽带的重要性。即使现在，作为一个成年人，这些记忆仍然激励和滋养着我的灵魂。
English_text: When I was a young child, summer break meant advancing above our aisles, a trip to my grandparents' farmhouse in the countryside. The anticipation of this visit always filled me with excitement, as I knew it promised a break from the pressure of city life. The moment we crossed the threshold, I was greeted by the freshly baked bread. My grandmother, with her apron tied around her waist, would always have a plate of warm cookies waiting for me. My grandfather, with his wetted hands and white smile, would take me on tours of the farm, introducing me to the various animals, from the curious chicken pecking at the ground to the gentle cows grazing in the meadow. Days at the farm were filled with simple joys. I spent hours in the garden, helping my grandmother plant flowers and vegetables, learning the names of each plant. In the afternoon, we'd often get around the old tree in the yard, where my grandfather would tell us the stories of his youth. His voice carrying the weight of existence. The words of his heart would echo in my mind. I stayed up all night, watching the flowers bloom and the flowers wither. I would enjoy the nature of the garden, the trees, and the sounds of the leaves. I would enjoy the beautiful nature of the garden. I would enjoy the nature of the garden. I would enjoy the nature of the garden. Evenings were magical, as the sky transformed into a convo of stars. My grandparents would set up a makeshift telescope, and together we'd explore the wonders of the cosmos and dreaming of distant worlds. Those summer days at my grandparents' farmhouse were a time of poor happiness. They taught me the value of hard work, the beauty of nature, and the importance of family bonds. Even now, as an adult, those memories continue to inspire and nourish my soul.

I would enjoy the nature of the garden, the trees, and the sounds of the leaves. I would enjoy the beautiful nature of the garden. I would enjoy the nature of the garden. I would enjoy the nature of the garden. Evenings were magical, as the sky transformed into a convo of stars. My grandparents would set up a makeshift telescope, and together we'd explore the wonders of the cosmos and dreaming of distant worlds. Those summer days at my grandparents' farmhouse were a time of poor happiness. They taught me the value of hard work, the beauty of nature, and the importance of family bonds. Even now, as an adult, those memories continue to inspire and nourish my soul.

Chinese_text: 2021年，我在旧金山拜访了我最好的朋友莎拉。由于疫情，我们已经将近两年没见面了，终于再次见到她，这让我们感到无比温暖。她在机场迎接我时笑容满面，我们在回她家的整个过程中都忍不住聊了起来。萨拉搬进了一间小而舒适的公寓，位于旧金山著名的陡峭山丘上。从她的窗户，我们可以看到缆车经过，感觉好像有什么东西挡住了我们的去路。在我访问期间，莎拉的任务是向我展示她在城市中最喜欢的所有地方。我们去了金门公园，在那里我们花了几个小时在花园里散步，在湖上看桨，甚至参观了日本茶园。花园的宁静与平和，以及精心排列的岩石和流动的溪流，感觉就像繁忙的城市生活中的绿洲。我们还穿过花园散步。我们走到金门大桥，那天风很大。我记得当我们欣赏海湾的壮丽景色时，风拉扯着我们的千斤顶。站在这样一个我只在照片中见过的标志性地标上，感觉超现实。在我们在一起的最后一个晚上，我们徒步登上了一座山峰，正好赶上日落。整个城市看起来都很美。整个城市看起来都很美。整个城市的生育习俗看起来都很美丽。花园就在我们下面。是的，我记得那是一个繁华的粉红色花园。用拇指把天空涂成橙色和粉色的美丽色调，我们坐在那里，再次锻炼身体，同时看着伟大的瑞文纳美丽地开始。是的，我记得那是一个繁华的粉红色花园。我们坐在那里，一边用摇铃看门，一边再次锻炼身体，我们坐在那儿，一边再次运动，一边看河，谈论我们的梦想以及过去几年发生了多大的变化。在与所有人会面几年后，我们回头看，只有塔玛拉。我们谈到了梦想，并意识到，尽管时间和距离遥远，但通过这些回忆和我们与你共度的岁月，我们仍然是一如既往的好朋友。我们还是一如既往的好朋友。
English_text: In 2021, I visited my best friend Sarah in San Francisco. We hadn't seen each other in nearly two years due to the pandemic, and finally meeting her again was incredible heartwarming. She greeted me at the airport with a huge smile, and we couldn't stop talking the whole ride back to her place. Sarah had moved into a small but cozy apartment located on one of those steep hills San Francisco is famous for. From her window, we could see cable cars going by, and it felt like something out of our way. During my visit, Sarah made it her mission to show me all her favorite places in the city. We went to Golden Gate Park, where we spent hours walking through gardens, watching paddles both on the lake and even visiting the Japanese tea garden. The peacefulness and calmness of the garden, with its carefully arranged rocks and flowing streams, felt like an oasis amidst the busy city life. We also took a walk across the garden. We walked to the Golden Gate Bridge, and it was a windy day. I remember the wind tugging at our jacks as we took in the breathtaking view of the bay. It felt surreal to be standing on such an iconic landmark, one I had only ever seen in pictures. On our last evening together, we hiked up to a peak just in time for the sunset. The entire city looked beautiful. The entire city looked beautiful. The entire city looked beautiful in its birthing custom. The garden lay below us. Yes, I recall it being a bustling pink garden. With the thumb painting the sky in beautiful shades of orange and pink, we sat there, engage exercise again while watching the greatبر revener beautifully always somehow starting off. Yes, I recall it being a bustling pink garden. We sat there, engage exercise again while watching thegate with our rattles, we sat there, engage exercise again while watching the river, talking about our dreams and how much has changed in the past couple of years. After a few years of meeting with all the people, we looked back, and it was just Tamara. We talked about the dream and realized that despite the time and the distance, through these memories and the years we made with you, we are still as olla good friends as ever. We are still as good friends as ever.

Chinese_text: 2020年，我去悉尼看望了一位10多年未见的老朋友。疫情期间，我们在网上重新联系，并谈了很多关于我们有多想念亲自出去玩的事情。所以，一旦旅行安全，我就预订了一次旅行。当我到达时，我的朋友在机场迎接我，给了我一个大大的拥抱。感觉时间过得飞快。我们在她公寓附近的一家小咖啡馆吃早餐，开始了新的一天。食物和咖啡都很棒，我们在分享生活故事时忍不住笑了起来。早餐后，我们决定乘渡船穿过悉尼港。天气很好，大海的景色很美。歌剧院的景色令人叹为观止。亲眼看到它与我看到的照片完全不同。我的朋友建议我们参加导游，这是个好主意。该指南分享了许多有趣的事实，比如它是如何花费数年时间建造的，以及它的设计是如何在全球竞争中被选中的。我们甚至听说了世界上最著名的歌剧院，世界上最着名的歌剧院和世界上最有名的歌剧院。我们诚挚地邀请您在4月4日参观我们的《剑与碎片》展览，这是我们第一次在东京的体育目录上看到一些表演，在冲绳女服务员的评论中，但现在我们抬起头来回顾一下我们所有人可能最错过的东西。这是一段美好的时光，尤其是在广播如此连续的情况下。这就像遇到了一个最初被称为Bonneville的人，aime Jong Koo，享受着城市的灯光，谈论着古老的回忆。这是一个充满幸福和难忘时刻的日子。
English_text: In 2020, I went to Sydney to visit an old friend I hadn't seen in over 10 years. We had reconnected online during the pandemic, and talked a lot about how much we missed hanging out in person. So, as soon as it was safe to travel, I booked a trip. When I arrived, my friend met me at the airport with a huge hug. It felt like no time had passed. We started the day with breakfast at a small cafe near her apartment. The food and coffee were great, and we couldn't stop laughing while sharing stories about our lives. After breakfast, we decided to take a ferry across Sydney Harbour. The weather was perfect, and the view of the ocean was beautiful. The view of the Opera House was stunning. Seeing it in person was completely different from the pictures I had seen. My friend suggested we take a guided tour, and it was such a good idea. The guide shared lots of interesting facts, like how it took years to build and how its design was chosen in a global competition. We even got to hear about the world's most famous opera house, and the world's most famous opera house, and the world's most famous opera house, and the world's most famous opera house, including myself. This is an invite for you to visit our quest for the Sword and Fragment exhibition on the 4th day of April, that was our first time seeing some performances on the sport catalog in Tokyo, at the waitressó okinawaó comment elsewhere, but now we're raising our heads to do a review of something that all of us have been probably most missed out on. It was a great time, especially as broadcasting was so consecutive. It was like meeting someone originally known as Bonneville,aime Jong-Koo, enjoying the city lights and talking about old memories. It was a day full of happiness and unforgettable moments.

Chinese_text: 几年前，我去了美国，特别是纽约市。这是我第一次访问这座城市，我非常兴奋地探索著名的地标，体验这里的文化，并看到这座我只在电影中见过的城市。一天下午，我决定在曼哈顿中心的标志性公园中央公园散步。阳光灿烂，公园里挤满了享受一天的人。当我走在公园边缘附近的一条四分之一径上时，我注意到了一些旧东西。一只狗坐在人行道旁。看起来迷失和困惑。这是一只中等大小的狗，皮毛邋遢，似乎在等人。但周围没有人。狗抬起悲伤的眼睛看着我，我可以看出它正在想下一步该怎么办。我慢慢地走近那只狗，希望不要吓到它，令我惊讶的是，它既没有跑开也没有朝我跑回来。它说，它说它轻微地摇了摇尾巴，好像在寻求帮助。我环顾四周，但街上空无一人，没有人在找它。我的第一反应是帮忙，于是我弯下腰，轻轻地抚摸着狗。它有点发抖，但我一开始抚摸它，狗似乎就平静下来了。几分钟后，一个女人出现在拐角处。几分钟后，一个女人出现在拐角处。几分钟后，一个女人出现在拐角处。几分钟后，一个女人出现在拐角处，喊着狗的名字。几分钟后，一个女人出现在拐角处，喊着狗的名字。狗立刻振作起来，朝她跑来。她看起来如释重负，并解释说，这只狗当天早些时候溜出了她的房子，已经失踪了几个小时。她非常感谢我陪着她的狗，并在她到达之前让它保持冷静。我感到一种压倒性的价值感和幸福感。我感到一种压倒性的价值感和幸福感。我感到一种压倒性的价值感和幸福感。知道我在让狗与主人团聚的过程中发挥了很小的作用。这是一个简单的善举，但它让我意识到，在一个人的生活中，有多少不同的小决定可以做出。那天，我带着一种满足感离开了。知道有时候善良和提供一点帮助可以让世界变得更美好。
English_text: A few years ago, I went on a trip to the United States, specifically to New York City. It was my first time visiting the city, and I was incredibly excited to explore the famous landmarks, experience the culture, and see the city that I had only ever seen in the movies. One afternoon, I decided to take a walk around Central Park, the iconic park in the heart of Manhattan. The sun was shining, and the park was bustling with people enjoying their day. As I walked down one of the quarter paths near the edge of the park, I noticed something old. A dog sitting by the sidewalk. Looking lost and confused. It was a medium-sized dog with a scruffy coat, and it seemed like it was waiting for someone. But no one was around. The dog looked up at me with sad eyes, and I could see that it was trying to figure out what to do next. I approached the dog slowly, hoping not to scare it, and to my surprise, it didn't run away or back at me. It said, It said it wagged its tail slightly, almost as if it was asking for help. I looked around, but the street was empty, and there was no sign of anyone looking for it. My first instinct was to help, so I bent down and gently petted the dog. It was shaking a little, but as soon as I started petting it, the dog seemed to calm down. A few minutes later, a woman appeared around the corner. A few minutes later, a woman appeared around the corner. A few minutes later, a woman appeared around the corner. A few minutes later, a woman appeared around the corner, calling the dog's name. A few minutes later, a woman appeared around the corner, calling the dog's name. The dog immediately perked up and ran toward her. She looked incredibly relieved and explained that the dog had slipped out of her house earlier that day and had been missing for hours. She thanked me profusely for staying with her dog and for keeping it calm until she arrived. I felt an overwhelming sense of worth and happiness. I felt an overwhelming sense of worth and happiness. I felt an overwhelming sense of worth and happiness. Knowing that I had played a small role in reuniting the dog with its owner. It was such a simple act of kindness, but it made me realize how much of the different small decisions can make in someone's life. That day, I walked away with a sense of fulfillment. Knowing that sometimes being kind and offering a little help can make the world a better place.

Chinese_text: 1920年，我前往芝加哥参加一个步行会议。这是我第一次来美国，我既兴奋又有点害怕。飞行很长，但我喜欢看窗外，思考前方的冒险。当我在奥黑尔机场降落时，我乘出租车去了酒店。高楼大厦、公共汽车和繁忙的街道让我觉得自己仿佛走进了一部电影。第二天晚上，我沿着芝加哥河滨步道散步。高楼大厦的灯光映在水面上，看起来很神奇。而且，当我走路的时候，我注意到一家小意大利餐厅似乎不太繁忙。我感到很好奇。我决定进去吃晚饭。食物很美味，这个地方感觉很舒适。我吃饭的时候，看见一个老人独自坐在靠窗的桌子旁。他正在素描，还在笔记本上画东西。我忍不住问他这件事。他热情地微笑着邀请我加入他。他告诉我，他曾经是一名慈善机构，曾在芝加哥的一些著名建筑上工作过。就像威尔斯大厦一样，他向我展示了一些令人惊叹的素描，并分享了他在这座城市的生活故事。我最终花了几个小时和他在一起，了解芝加哥的历史和人民。成为他让我的旅行变得更加特别。虽然我没有时间探索这座城市的一切，但这些回忆仍然伴随着我。我希望有一天我能回到芝加哥，创造更多这样的回忆。
English_text: In 1920, I traveled to Chicago for a walk meeting. It was my first time visiting the United States, and I felt both excited and a bit scared. The flight was long, but I enjoyed looking out of the window and thinking about the adventure ahead. When I landed at O'Hare Airport, I took a taxi to my hotel. The tall buildings and the bus and busy street made me feel like I had stepped into a movie. On my second evening, I went for a walk along the Chicago Riverwalk. The lights from the tall buildings reflected on the water, and it looked magical. And, as I was walking, I noticed a small Italian restaurant that didn't seem very busy. I felt curious. I decided to go in and have dinner there. The food was delicious, and the place felt very cozy. While I was eating, I saw an old man sitting alone at a table near the window. He was sketching, and he was drawing something in a notebook. I couldn't help but ask him about it. He smiled warmly and invited me to join him. He told me he used to be a charity and had worked on some Chicago's famous buildings. Like the Wells Tower, he showed me some of his sketches, which were amazing, and, he shared stories about his life in the city. I ended up spending hours taking to him, learning about Chicago's history and its people. Being him made my trip so much more special. Although I didn't have time to explore everything in the city, the memories still with me. I hope I can return to Chicago one day to create more memories like this.

Chinese_text: 2018年，我终于有机会访问日本东京，这是一个我多年来一直梦想探索的城市。这是一次为期一周的旅行，每天都充满了兴奋和新的体验。从我降落的那一刻起，我就惊讶于一切是多么干净有序。树上挤满了人，但有一种平静的感觉，让这座城市感觉如此独特。第一天，我参观了涩谷十字路口，这是世界上最繁忙的人行横道。看到数百人同时从各个方向穿过街道，真是令人难以置信，但一切都进展得如此顺利。我站在那里看了一会儿，然后自己也加入了人群过马路。感觉就像我是电影场景的一部分。后来，我漫步在附近满是商店和餐馆的街道上。我品尝了一些美味的街头小吃，包括高崎和风味冰淇淋。我这次旅行的亮点是参观了三鹰的吉卜力博物馆。作为吉卜力工作室电影《远离母乳》和《龙猫》的粉丝，感觉就像走进了魔法世界。博物馆里充满了神秘的展品，比如真人大小的弹射器和著名的电影手绘草图。甚至在街道中央还有一个博物馆。甚至还有一个小剧院，我在那里看了一部博物馆独有的动画短片。这是一次难忘的经历，让我更加欣赏这些电影背后的创造力。有一天，我坐火车去浅草参观浅草寺，这是东京最古老、最著名的寺庙之一。大门上挂着巨大的红灯笼。这太令人印象深刻了。我走过Nakamise购物街，街上有很多卖纪念品和传统小吃的小商店。我买了一个小护身符来祈求好运，并尝试了一些新鲜制作的太烧，这是一种鱼形蛋糕，里面装满了甜红豆沙。东京是我所希望的一切，甚至更多。现代摩天大楼和传统寺庙的结合，美味的食物，礼貌友好的人们使它成为一个与众不同的城市。东京是我所希望的一切，甚至更多。现代摩天大楼和传统寺庙的结合，美味的食物，礼貌友好的人们使它成为一个与众不同的城市。当我离开时，我感到有点难过，但我知道有一天我会回来探索东京所能提供的更多东西。
English_text: In 2018, I finally had the chance to visit Tokyo, Japan, a city I had dreamed of exploring for years. It was a week-long trip, and every day was filled with excitement and new experiences. From the moment I landed, I was amazed by how clean and orderly everything was. The trees were bustling with people, yet there was a sense of calm that made the city feel so unique. On my first day, I visited Shibuya Crossing, the world's busiest pedestrian intersection. It was incredible to see hundreds of people crossing the street from every direction at once, yet everything moved so smoothly. I stood there for a while just taking it all in and then joined the crowd to cross the street myself. It felt like I was part of a movie scene. Later, I wandered through the nearby streets filled with shops and restaurants. I tried some delicious street food, including takoyaki and flavored ice cream. The highlight of my trip was visiting the Ghibli Museum in Mitaka. As a fan of studio Ghibli films like Breasted Away and My Neighbor Totoro, it felt like stepping into the magical world. The museum was full of mystical exhibits like life-sized catapults and famous beautiful hand-drawn sketches from the movies. There was even a museum in the middle of the street. There was even a small theater where I watched a short animated film that was exclusive to the museum. It was an unforgettable experience that made me appreciate the creativity behind those movies even more. One day, I took a train to Asakusa to visit Sensoji Temple, one of Tokyo's oldest and most famous temples. The main gate with its giant red lantern. It was so impressive. I walked through the Nakamise shopping street lined with small shops selling souvenirs and traditional snacks. I bought a little charm for good luck and tried some freshly made taiyaki, a fish-shaped cake filled with sweet red bean paste. Tokyo was everything I had hoped for and more. The mix of modern skyscrapers and traditional temples, the delicious food, and the polite and friendly people made it a city like no other. Tokyo was everything I had hoped for and more. The mix of modern skyscrapers and traditional temples, the delicious food, and the polite and friendly people made it a city like no other. When I left, I felt a little sad, but I knew I would come back one day to explore even more of what Tokyo had to offer.

Chinese_text: 去年春天，我有机会在樱花盛开的季节访问日本东京。我一直想看樱花，它比我想象的还要好。我在学期之间的短暂休息时间去了东京，正好赶上花朵盛开的时候。当我走出火车站时，我看到到处都是樱桃树，在街道上，在公园里，在河边。第一天，我去了哲学家关。这是一条小运河旁边的石关，两边都是樱桃树。花朵盛开，一些花瓣落入水中，使它看起来是粉红色的。我沿着山口慢慢地走着，欣赏着风景。那里有很多人，有些人在拍照，有些人只是坐在树下，尽管天气多云。感觉很平静。我非常高兴。每个人似乎都很高兴能在那里，享受着鲜花。晚上，我去了另一个公园。这照亮了樱桃树，看起来很神奇。公园里最大的树上开满了淡粉色的花，它的灯光让它看起来像做梦一样。那里有很多人，一些人坐在毯子上，另一些人在树下慢慢地走着。我走在盛开的花朵下，感觉自己仿佛置身于一个不同的世界。
English_text: Last spring, I got a chance to visit Tokyo, Japan during the cherry blossom season. I had always wanted to see the cherry blossom, and it was even better than I imagined. I went to Tokyo during a short break between semesters just in time for the blossoms to be at their best. When I stepped out of the train station, I saw cherry trees everywhere, on the streets, in the parks, and around the rivers. On the first day, I went to Philosopher's Pass. It is a stone pass next to a small canal, and both sides are lined with cherry trees. The blossoms were in full bloom, and some of the petals were falling into the water, making it look pink. I walked slowly along the pass, enjoying the view. There were many people there, some taking pictures, some just sitting under the trees, even though it was cloudy. It felt very peaceful. I was very happy. Everyone seemed happy just to be there, enjoying the flowers. In the evening, I went to another park. This had lit up the cherry trees, and it looked magical. The biggest trees in the park were full of pale pink flowers, and its lights made it seem like something out of a dream. Many people were there, some sitting on blankets, others walking slowly under the trees. I walked under the glowing blossoms, feeling like I was in a different world.
